sub_title: Learning Experience Designer at Pon | UX Design | Service Design | Inclusive Design
summary:
Hi! I'm Milla, and I love connecting the dots to shape accessible and intuitive products/services. With my background in Technology and Information Management and Industrial Design Engineering, I intertwine my skills and address challenges (in various industries) with a human-centric approach. 

I deeply value co-creating with diverse communities, embracing their perspectives and needs, and developing meaningful (online and offline) experiences. In addition to my positive energy, eagerness to take on new challenges, and adaptability, my key strengths include:

• fostering inclusive environments and facilitating interactions
• conducting mixed methods user research and making evidence-based design decisions
• transforming complex data into compelling stories and actionable insights
• optimizing processes and workflows

Next to my interest in learning about peoples' (product/service) experiences, I enjoy playing the piano, ballroom dancing, and skiing. Curious to hear about you -- let's have a chat!

profile_positions.company: Pon Equipment and Pon Power BV
profile_positions.description:
• Designing an accessible and practical sustainability development program that motivates our customer-facing personnel to gain more knowledge about the transition toward a sustainable construction site
• Conducting a pilot test of the program with 40+ customer-facing personnel
• Establishing a cross-functional sustainability team
• Developing learning modules and strategies to engage subject matter experts
• Advising on AI technologies that can optimize the learning content creation process
• Developing a 1-year strategic plan and service blueprint to align 10+ stakeholders
• Increasing interest and momentum for the program, resulting in its official launch within the next month
profile_positions.title: Learning Experience Designer

profile_positions.description:
The X!LEAD Leadership and Innovation Program is a traineeship focused on personal and professional development.

• Impacting innovation projects at multiple companies in different industries as a human-centered designer while following a personal development program
• Following a tailor-made personal development program that includes innovation/tech/consultancy trainings and coaching sessions
profile_positions.title: X!LEAD Leadership and Innovation Program Trainee

profile_positions.description:
• Redesigned X!LEAD’s website in less than one month and collaborated with a third-party digital design agency during development. Integrated web analytics tools to better understand how to improve/maintain the website
• Strengthened the brand identity. Developed multiple marketing materials to communicate our brand and ensured consistency across all touchpoints.
• Developed and executed social media strategy (via X!LEAD’s first Instagram account)
• Developed trainee recruitment and partner acquisition strategies; led the acquisition of start-ups and some trainee recruitment activities
• Empowered prospective trainees and answered trainee inquiries promptly
• Facilitated 12 interviews with X!LEAD clients to better understand how to improve program/service experience. Also prepared a workshop set-up to gain a deeper understanding their experiences.
profile_positions.title: UX Strategist and Designer - X!LEAD

profile_positions.description:
• Facilitated project meetings with the Autonomous Airport working group, structured team processes and workflows, and delegated responsibilities effectively
• Created a pitch deck for decision-makers to strengthen Bright Sky’s initiative message
profile_positions.title: Project Manager - Bright Sky

profile_positions.description:
In addition to being an X!LEAD partner, RoboHouse is a future of work fieldlab on the TU Delft Campus where robot developments and the study of social processes can occur simultaneously. 

• Designed an event proposal template to optimize the event planning process among multiple stakeholders which is now used by the Community Manager
• Led internal (e.g. RoboCafé) and external (e.g. European Robotics Forum, ERF) event logistics and aligned with 25+ stakeholders
• Designed two interactive exhibition booth areas (floor plans created via SketchUp, a 3D design software) and a variety of marketing materials to showcase robotics projects at ERF (ERF areas included: Lely/RoboHouse Hackathon Challenge and Delft Robotics Institute/RoboHouse/SAM|XL)
• Developed a data management MVP that allows RoboHouse employees to connect its client’s business challenge to student teams/universities
profile_positions.title: Product Designer

profile_positions.description:
Yumen Bionics creates the future of assistive technology driven by the Duchenne Muscular Dystrophy community.

MSc Design for Interaction Thesis: "Designing Motivational Data for Males with Duchenne Muscular Dystrophy"

• Conducted generative research and designed mobile interactions that could help motivate males with Duchenne Muscular Dystrophy to move an optimal amount and give them a central role in managing/viewing their exoskeleton arm movement data
profile_positions.title: UX / UI Design Graduate Intern

profile_positions.description:
After a successful internship, I continued to work with Woov as their first UX Researcher.

• Conducted mixed methods research which shaped the product vision and roadmap
profile_positions.title: User Experience Researcher

profile_positions.description:
Woov is a festival and live music platform and has a mission to make the live music experience accessible to a global community.

• Focused on researching (and rapidly prototyping) how Woov can provide an engaging and exciting digital experience, especially during COVID-19 times
• Pioneered an overall framework for user research processes/shaped UX research practices along with the Senior UX Designer in order to complement an Agile environment 
• Created an international user panel of 100+ people and managed participant recruitment
• Conducted qualitative/quantitative UX research cycles using various methodologies (e.g. surveys, interviews, diary studies, usability tests, data analytics, behavioral observations software, etc.)
• Created prototypes via Figma, an interface design tool, to develop new/improve product features
• Collaborated cross-functionally on various OKRs
profile_positions.title: Product Design Intern

profile_positions.description: • Coordinated activities with the course coordinators for the Inclusive Design MSc elective
profile_positions.title: Teaching Assistant

profile_positions.description:
The summer camp is designed to connect with kinesthetic, auditory, and traditional learners and work to create a virtuous cycle of enthusiasm toward writing.

• Boosted 8-9 year old childrens' confidence in writing (via an eBook creation process as a framework) and assisted in executing lesson plans/teaching them writing skills
• Facilitated activities, both physical and writing
profile_positions.title: Camp Counselor (Adventure Guide)

profile_positions.description:
The Assistive Sociotechnical Solutions for Individuals with Special needs using Technology (ASSIST) Lab aims to help people with special needs (PSN) maintain a high quality of life through technology. 

SpokeIt: An Interactive Game for Cleft Speech (project that was worked on alongside Ph.D student, Jared Duval and the SpokeIt team) is a game created with the goal of making practicing speech fun and effective. It benefits children with cleft lip/palate because it aims to make practice seamless, gives speech therapists access to their patient’s progress, and assigns words and phrases that are suitable for the child to exercise.

Through a partnership with "Smile Train",  a nonprofit organization and charity that supports more than 1.5 million corrective surgeries for children with cleft lips and palates in more than 70+ countries, SpokeIt will be delivered around the world in many languages. 

• Conducted two user studies at Santa Cruz's "Hope Services" to evaluate the mini-games
• Analyzed user study results and created relevant data visualizations via "Tableau"
• Collaborated cross-functionally (with graphic designers, voice actors, and software engineers)
• Conducted a competitive analysis to provide insight into other speech therapy games 
• Co-wrote "SpokeIt: Building a Mobile Speech Therapy Experience" (MobileHCI 2018, Spain)
• Developed an original storyboard for the “Musical Migs” mini-game
• Created a mini-game called “The Musical Migs” using Swift, Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, Character Animator, After Effects, and Premiere Pro
• Publicized SpokeIt progress via social media platforms
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant/Intern
